moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5: Center Counter Game, an opening which leads to fast tactics.
moves.2... Qxd5: Black plays for the immediate recapture.
moves.3. Nc3: The usual move, harassing the Queen.
moves.3... Qd8: The modern move is 3... Q-QR4, setting up a pin on the White Knight.
moves.6. h3 Bxf3 7. Qxf3: Black should continue developing with 7... N-B3. Instead, he makes a small mistake.
moves.8... Nbd7 9. Nb5 Rc8 10. Nxa7 Nb6: Losing the Exchange. Black is starting to come apart.
moves.11. Nxc8 Nxc8 12. d4: Opening a line for the QB to join the attack.
moves.12... Nd6 13. Bb5+: Istead of retreating the attacked Queen, White continues his offensive.
moves.18... Qg6: Looking to snatch back a Pawn, but removing the Q from the defense.
moves.19. Bf4: Trying to divert the Black Bishop.

players: Francesco di Castellvi  vs. Narciso Vinyoles
